name: assistant.search.context
desc: Searches messages across your Slack organizationâ€”perfect for broad, specific, and real-time data retrieval.

action_token.desc: Send action_token as received in a message event.

channel_types.desc: Mix and match channel types by providing a comma-separated list of any combination of public_channel, private_channel, mpim, im.

content_types.desc: Content types to include, a comma-separated list of any combination of messages, files, channels, users.

include_bots.desc: Whether the results should include bots.

include_deleted_users.desc: Whether to include deleted users in the user search results. Defaults to false.

before.desc: UNIX timestamp filter. If present, filters for results before this date.

after.desc: UNIX timestamp filter. If present, filters for results after this date.

include_context_messages.desc: Whether to include context messages surrounding the main message result. Defaults to false if unspecified.

context_channel_id.desc: Context channel ID to support scoping the search when applicable.

cursor.desc: The cursor returned by the API. Leave this blank for the first request and use this to get the next page of results.

limit.desc: Number of results to return, up to a max of 20. Defaults to 20.

sort.desc: The field to sort the results by. Defaults to score. Can be one of: score, timestamp.

sort_dir.desc: The direction to sort the results by. Defaults to desc.

include_message_blocks.desc: Whether to return the message blocks in the response.

highlight.desc: Whether to highlight the search query in the results. Defaults to false if unspecified.

term_clauses.desc: A list of term clauses. A term clause is a string with search terms. Search results returned will match every term clause specified (i.e., conjunctive normal form).

modifiers.desc: A string containing only modifiers in the format of modifier:value. Search results returned will match the modifier value. For now modifiers only affect term clauses.

include_archived_channels.desc: Whether to include archived channels in the search results.
